name: Neo-Y evolution with male recombination in D. albomicans
description: Drosophila albomicans has a pair of young neo-sex chromosomes. Surprisingly, the males of this species used to recombine. We explore the effects recombination has had on the neo-Y chromsome.

name: Assembling the massive neo-Y of D. miranda
description: Drosophila miranda has a neo-Y chromosome that is ~1 million years old. Because it is heavily degenerate with pseudogenes and repetitive elements, we used multiple state-of-the-art genome assembly technologies to piece it together. This includes Pac-Bio, BAC clone, and BioNano sequencing and scaffolding with chromosome contact data (Hi-C). The resulting neo-Y chromosome is in two contigs, and is three times the size of the ancestral autosome from which it derived.

name: Evolution of simple satellites in Drosophila
description: We profiled the simple satellite landscape across 9 Drosophila species.

name: Detecting meiotic drive with pooled sequencing
description: We developed a new approach that integrates classical genetics with genomics to identify non-Mendelian transmission frequency. Using this approach we identified a weak centromeric driver.
